item.title: The Faceless YouTube Stack
item.description:
The Faceless YouTube Stack

A complete YouTube channel without showing your face or hiring anyone. AI writes your scripts, generates your voice, creates your visuals, and you just edit and upload. Channels using this approach are pulling 10K–100K+ views per video in niches like finance, history, tech explainers, and motivation.

Who It’s For

  • Best for: Side-hustlers, niche content creators, and anyone who wants YouTube ad revenue without being on camera.
  • Not for: Vloggers, personality-driven creators, or anyone whose audience expects a human face. Also not ideal if you need real-world footage (travel, cooking).

The Tools

Tool Role Cost
Claude Script writing — research, outlines, full scripts $20/mo
ElevenLabs AI voiceover — natural narration $5–22/mo
Stable Diffusion / Midjourney Visual generation — backgrounds, illustrations, thumbnails $0–10/mo
CapCut / DaVinci Resolve Video editing — assembly, captions, effects $0 (free tiers)

Premium (all paid tiers + stock footage sub) ~$70/mo

Freedom Score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

  • Why 4: You own your channel, your scripts, and your video files. Voice and images are generated fresh each time. Swapping any single tool is straightforward.
  • Lock-in risk: Minimal. The only real dependency is your YouTube channel itself — but that’s the distribution, not the tooling.

Getting Started (This Weekend)

  1. Pick your niche. Top faceless niches: personal finance, AI/tech explainers, history, psychology, “top 10” lists, motivation. Pick one you can talk about for 100 videos.
  2. Set up Claude. Create a system prompt: “You are a YouTube scriptwriter for a [niche] channel. Scripts should be 8-12 minutes of spoken content with visual cues in brackets.”
  3. Generate your first script. Ask Claude for a script on a trending topic in your niche. Include hook, body, CTA.
  4. Record voiceover in ElevenLabs. Paste the script, pick a voice, download the MP3.
  5. Generate visuals. Use the visual cues from your script to prompt Stable Diffusion or Midjourney. Aim for 15-25 images per video.
  6. Assemble in CapCut or DaVinci Resolve. Drop in narration, layer visuals on the timeline, add auto-captions, background music, transitions.
  7. Upload and optimize. Use Claude to write your title, description, and tags.

Expected output: 2-3 videos/week. Each video takes 3-5 hours start to finish once you have a rhythm.

item.title: Tools for Faceless YouTube
item.description:
Tools for Faceless YouTube

Running a YouTube channel without showing your face. Here are the AI tools that make it possible.

See also: The Faceless YouTube Stack — our recommended full workflow.

Scriptwriting

  • Claude — Best overall for long-form YouTube scripts. Handles research, outlines, and full 10-minute scripts with visual cues. Excellent at matching a channel’s voice with system prompts.
  • Kimi K2.5 — Strong alternative with large context window. Good for research-heavy scripts that need lots of source material.

Voiceover

  • ElevenLabs — The gold standard for AI voiceover. Natural-sounding narration, voice cloning, and multiple languages. Most faceless channels use this.

Visual Generation

  • Midjourney — Highest quality AI images for thumbnails and video visuals. Discord-based workflow.
  • Stable Diffusion (local via ComfyUI) — Free, uncensored, unlimited. Requires a GPU but saves $10+/mo over Midjourney.

Video Editing

  • CapCut — Free, auto-captions, easy timeline editing. Most faceless creators start here.
  • DaVinci Resolve — Professional-grade, free tier is incredibly powerful. Steeper learning curve but more control.

Thumbnail Generation

  • Midjourney — Eye-catching thumbnails with text overlay added in Canva or Photoshop.
  • Stable Diffusion — Same quality potential, free, more control over iterations.

item.title: The 30-Minute Video Pipeline
item.description:
What is this?

A step-by-step workflow for producing a complete YouTube video using AI tools. From blank page to uploaded video in under an hour of active work.

The Stack

Step Tool Time
Script Claude / GPT 15 min
Voiceover ElevenLabs 2 min
Audio cleanup ffmpeg (automated) 30 sec
Visuals Gemini 3 Pro 5 min
Assembly Kdenlive 20 min
Total ~45 min

The Workflow

Step 1: Script (15 min)

Use Claude or GPT to draft the script. Provide your topic, target length, and tone. Review and tweak — don’t accept the first draft.
